name: Hotel Hari Piorko

reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of nights on our arrival in delhi and then again on our return home,also using it as a base when we en route to Manali. As we were traveling with small kids(4,5), I also booked airport pick up on arrival,which took the hassle out of looking for a taxi. The staff are very helpful and the travel desk and money change good, although I did have an issue with a bus booking ,when we were taken off a luxury bus and put onto a more run down red bus- all the way to Manali with a vomitting child!
reviews.title: Very good hotel for the location

reviews.text: I was issued a partial refund to compensate for this problem and felt satisfied with the explanation given, Independence day had meant the buses were much busier than usual.
reviews.title: Great and comfortable stay

reviews.text: The restaurant was a pleasant respite from the general squalor of the Parahganj,as was the hotel, with standard western fayre as well as some underspiced Indian dishes. I would recommend this Hotel to people looking to be in this area but also wanting some mod cons and comfort. Thankyou to all at Hari Piorko x
reviews.title: Good choice in a crowded city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say its an amazing hotel with good and kind service. Loved everything from their room to the restaurant to the rooftop. I ahd booked a room that had an aquarium, but i got a room without it. So i asked the staff, and they promptly changed it. I was well, happy.
reviews.title: Central, great value hotel

reviews.text: Pretty good deal !
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was good for Delhi at the price we paid. It was clean, which is important in India, the staff were friendly and the rooftop terrace was inviting. The fish tank was a nice touch and helped the rooms provide a relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Clean hotel...bad area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose to stay in Pahar Ganj as I'd read it was the back packer area but I didn't really see that many other back packers around. I'd say there are nicer areas to stay in. It's also more expensive to get rickshaws back to Pahar Ganj in the evenings as the streets are so congested it takes the drivers a long time to get back out.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in the busy Main Bazar street in Paharganj

reviews.text: Watch out for people trying to scam you in the street outside the hotel and on the street round the corner to Connaught Place. We were approached by a young guy who started walking with us and offered to show us to the government tourist office where some other guy tried to rip us off for A LOT of money. There is actually only 1 government tourist office in Delhi, make sure you go to the right one, all the others are just a group of guys, with a shop, trying to scam tourists; they even have signs saying they're government offices!
reviews.title: Great for our expedition teams

reviews.text: If you can put up with the madness of Pahar Ganj I'd say this hotel is a good choice.
reviews.title: Tourist Friendly

reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 nights before our flight back. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was clean and had a nice size. Warm water available. Unfortunately there was no window in the room which is quite annoying. The food in the restaurant was good. The Hotel is in the very busy Main Bazar area in Paharganj between Ramakrishna Ashram Marg Metro Station and the New Delhi train station.
reviews.title: Great value & good service

reviews.text: Every time I visit Delhi it used to be a hard exercise to find appropriate hotel close to my work and livable. Hari piorKo had solved all my problem. Below are my Pros and Cons for the Hotel.
reviews.title: Would have been an Star Hotel if it had been out of Paharganj

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, if you want to stay at Paharganj Main Bazar area

reviews.text: 1. Very Economical
reviews.title: Affordable Hari Piorko

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Excellent Reception and Hotel Staff
reviews.title: Very good, clean hotel

reviews.text: 3. Cleanliness
reviews.title: "Very Impressive"

reviews.text: I was in the hotel for two nights. The room is very clean and the room service is very nice. I had booked the hotel through Makemytrip.com. The money the had charged worth of it. Though the hotel is in the market place but it can be easily located and it is in walk-able distance from New Delhi railway station.
reviews.title: Nice staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in the semi deluxe room (cheapest). The room was clean, the bathroom was nice, the bed was lovely. The people were nice and helpfull at times. We asked for a pickup and when we landed we called the hotel to confirm the pickup, they didn't know about it. Later at the hotel, after we payed for a taxi to bring us there, they said they arranged something and he had been waiting.
reviews.title: Just good
Pay half a day's rent if click ticks 12 noon
reviews.text: There were a lot of problems with the AC and it took them (2 times) 30 minutes to even get to the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant (inside and on the roof) was cheap and very good value. The food was good, especcially the indian food. But there was barely any communication between the hotel staff and the restaurant, so that was confusing sometimes.
reviews.title: Thanks to all the team of the Hotel Hari Piorko, the best place to stay in Delhi !

reviews.text: in short, we had a good, clean room. Just that the staff had minor problems.
reviews.title: Best hotel for the price.

description: Hotel Hari Piorko is a landmark in the midst of busy market New Delhi, where hospitality stands first. Covering 5000 sq. yards space with elegant interiors & teak wood furniture designed for comfort.
